title: How to Make a Milkshake Without Ice Cream
original_title: How To Create A Milkshake Without Ice Cream
content: hello there my name is Valerie McClane and otherwise known as nutrition angel and today I'm going to show you how to make some of really delicious healthy drinks so what you need here are four basic ingredients this is happens to be a vanilla one so you need one cup of milk need two to three dates depending on whether you have a sweet tooth or not you need some vanilla extract you probably need about one to two teaspoons again depending on your tastes and what I'm using here is something called mesquite mill which is a really nice caramel taste then all you need to do is add the ingredients to your blender and blend you can add ice to this if you want just to give it a more of a chilled taste and that's how to make a milkshake for that ice cream

title: How to Make a Milkshake Without Ice Cream
original_title: Milkshakes : How to Make a Homemade milkshake With Ice Cream
content: hello my name is Pete Dryden and I'm going to show you to make a homemade shake with ice cream things you will need vanilla ice cream milk strawberries a blender and a large glass the first step is to pour some milk into the blender then scoop out three or four scoops of ice cream and add it to the blender the more ice cream you add the thicker the shake will be now add the desired amount of strawberries or any other fruit you desire then turn the blender on and blend until smooth and creamy pour into a large glass and serve and that is how you make a homemade shake with ice cream

title: How to Make a Milkshake Without Ice Cream
original_title: How to Make a Milkshake
content: how to make a milkshake forget the smoothies granitas cool lattes and other frozen imitators there's nothing that satisfies your sweet tooth like a good old-fashioned milkshake you will need your favorite ice cream an ice cream scoop a blender 1 to 2 tablespoons of your desired flavored syrup or less for vanilla extract 1/2 a cup of milk a large glass and a straw optional hot water from the faucet and some fruit of your choice step 1 scoop your ice cream into the blender you'll need for full scoops if you have trouble dipping into hard ice cream run your scoop under hot water to heat it up between scoops step 2 pour the syrup and milk into the blender add complimentary fruit to your shake like real strawberries 2 strawberry ice cream or bananas to chocolate ice cream step 3 put the top on the blender and blend on medium speed until it's smooth and creamy step 4 pour the milkshake into a large glass if your added fruit to your shake garnish the glass by hanging a piece on the rim step 5 drop in the straw take your first big slurp then raise your glass to old-school ice cream drinks did you know in soda fountain parlance a black and white is a milkshake made with chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream

milkshake you will need your favorite
ice cream an ice cream scoop a blender 1

flavored syrup or less for vanilla
extract 1/2 a cup of milk a large glass
and a straw optional hot water from the
faucet and some fruit of your choice
step 1 scoop your ice cream into the
blender you'll need for full scoops if
you have trouble dipping into hard ice
cream run your scoop under hot water to
heat it up between scoops step 2
pour the syrup and milk into the blender
add complimentary fruit to your shake
like real strawberries 2 strawberry ice
cream or bananas to chocolate ice cream
step 3 put the top on the blender and
blend on medium speed until it's smooth
and creamy step 4 pour the milkshake
into a large glass if your added fruit
to your shake garnish the glass by
hanging a piece on the rim
step 5 drop in the straw take your first
big slurp then raise your glass to
old-school ice cream drinks did you know
in soda fountain parlance a black and
white is a milkshake made with chocolate
syrup and vanilla ice cream

content: hey guys it's Tessa from handle the heat comm and today I'm so thrilled to be showing you how to make ice cream right in your own kitchen with no machine or ice cream maker required I'm going to be showing you three simple no churn techniques that you can use which is the simplest ingredients and tools that you probably already have in your own kitchen so be sure to watch all the way to the end for the best tips and tricks and also be sure to click to blog post that goes along with this video because I've included tons of flavor customization ideas for you to use to really get creative in the kitchen and I also included a special bonus and that is really cute and adorable ice cream labels you can print out and attach to your ice cream and make it a super fun and cute project so if you'd like to learn how to make ice cream with Auto machine then just keep watching alright so we're starting off with the easiest method and that's the two ingredient method so for this ice cream all you need is 2 cups of heavy cream that's been chilled and a can of sweetened condensed milk that's it we're going to be adding some other flavor options but that is all that you need so with the cream in my KitchenAid mixer and the whisk attachment I am just going to whip that up until it forms stiff peaks and once that happens I'm going to add in my sweetened condensed milk but not without taking a little taste of cream first so I'm adding in 1 14 ounce can of sweetened condensed milk which I've actually also chilled and I'm just slowly mixing that in to the whipped cream then I'm adding in a bit of vanilla extract and for this recipe I'm going to turn this icecream into a peanut butter cup ice cream so I'm adding in half a cup of peanut butter which I've just briefly melted in the microwave just enough so that it is horrible now I'm adding in half a cup of chopped up Reese's piece or Reese's candies you can add in any type of peanut butter candy you want and you can add in any type of spread that you want so instead of peanut butter if you want to do Nutella or cookie butter or whatever feel free to go nuts just make sure that you freeze for six hours before serving that ice cream okay so that was the two ingredient method now we're going to move on to the other methods which you can use any ice cream recipe for I'm going to show you my favorite basic ice cream base this is super simple I just added one and a half cups or one and a quarter cups of whole milk which has been chilled to 3/4 cup of granulated sugar and I just whisk that up until the sugar dissolved now I'm adding in two cups of heavy cream which has been chilled a generous heaping a vanilla extract and a quarter teaspoon of fine salt and I'm just going to give that another little whisk until it all comes together and now you can totally customize this base with any flavors you want or you can just keep it vanilla I decided to do mint chocolate chip for my flavor and I just added in one cup of mini chocolate chips a teaspoon of peppermint extract and a few drops of green food coloring the food coloring is totally optional and usually not a fan but for some reason you just got to have green when it comes to mint chocolate chip so my other flavor I want to do is mocha so I added in two tablespoons of espresso powder and a cup of Dutch process cocoa powder now you can use any cocoa powder you want I just love Dutch process because it is so deep and dark in color it just makes for a beautiful result so for this mocha ice cream I'm actually going to use to freeze and stir method I've just placed the ice cream mixture in a shallow baking dish and popped it in the freezer for 30 minutes and now I'm just going to whisk it up you can see it's starting to get a little bit of frozen bits in it and I'm going to basically repeat this process pop it in a freezer for 30 minutes whisking putting it back in the freezer whisking until it starts to form a thickened ice cream and texture and you know that it's ready when it starts to kind of stick to the pan and hold the shape of the pan so it takes about 2 to 3 hours for this process all together and once you're done you can pour the ice cream into a container a sealable container and you're good to go and of course you have to have a little taste before you do that just to make sure it's good the next method is the plastic method and you may have done this in science classes in school or for a summer project but basically you place your ice cream mixture in a quart size bag you may need to use two quarts ice bags and I had a little bit left over but I just use the one and then place it in another quart size bag so you want to make sure it's perfectly sealed now we're placing those two bags in a freezer bag and adding in 4 tablespoons of coarse salt you saw that I used ice cream salt but you can also use regular salt ice cream salt does work best but regular salt will get the job done so to that salt I added also and about 4 cups of ice I actually ended up adding more ice and you see here our ice maker was being a little uncooperative but what you do is just shake it you just shake it vigorously shake it like you have a vendetta against this ice cream and once you're done it'll look like soft-serve ice cream and you can pop it in the freezer until it kind of gets a little bit harder and that is the beautiful creamy luscious result this one was the freezin store method for my mocha chocolate ice cream and then of course one of my favorites the two ingredient method for my peanut butter cup ice cream Oh can't you just taste the bite and don't forget to download my free ice cream labels at the link below alright guys so how easy were those three methods for making ice cream without a machine I really hope you enjoy them as much as we do and use them all summer long maybe even into winter because let's face it I just face is good all year round and I just adore these totally cute ice cream pint containers that you can get off Amazon I'd link to them below and they make for such a fun project so many flavor customization options is pretty much limitless so really get creative here and I'd love to hear your favorite ice cream flavors that you plan on making with these recipes so leave me a comment below I really hope you guys enjoyed this video if you did give it a thumbs up and don't forget to subscribe to my channel I'll see you next time with another food video and right now I'm going to take a bite of my peanut butter cup ice cream because it looks and smells amazing mmm so rich and creamy this is was the sweetened condensed milk and cream method and it just is it'll blow your mind if you haven't made this before so I'll catch your own soon

one cup of mini chocolate chips a
teaspoon of peppermint extract and a few
drops of green food coloring the food
coloring is totally optional and usually
not a fan but for some reason you just
got to have green when it comes to mint
chocolate chip so my other flavor I want
to do is mocha so I added in two
tablespoons of espresso powder and a cup
of Dutch process cocoa powder now you
can use any cocoa powder you want I just
love Dutch process because it is so deep
and dark in color it just makes for a
beautiful result so for this mocha ice
cream I'm actually going to use to
freeze and stir method I've just placed
the ice cream mixture in a shallow
baking dish and popped it in the freezer
for 30 minutes and now I'm just going to
whisk it up you can see it's starting to
get a little bit of frozen bits in it
and I'm going to basically repeat this
process pop it in a freezer for 30
minutes whisking putting it back in the
freezer whisking until it starts to form
a thickened ice cream and texture and
you know that it's ready when it starts
to kind of stick to the pan and hold the
shape of the pan so it takes about 2 to
3 hours for this process all together
and once you're done you can pour the
ice cream into a container a sealable
container and you're good to go
and of course you have to have a little
taste before you do that just to make
sure it's good the next method is the
plastic
method and you may have done this in
science classes in school or for a
summer project but basically you place
your ice cream mixture in a quart size
bag you may need to use two quarts ice
bags and I had a little bit left over
but I just use the one and then place it
in another quart size bag so you want to
make sure it's perfectly sealed now
we're placing those two bags in a
freezer bag and adding in 4 tablespoons
of coarse salt you saw that I used ice
cream salt but you can also use regular
salt ice cream salt does work best but
regular salt will get the job done so to
that salt I added also and about 4 cups
of ice I actually ended up adding more
ice and you see here our ice maker was
being a little uncooperative but what
you do is just shake it you just shake
it vigorously shake it like you have a
vendetta against this ice cream and once
you're done it'll look like soft-serve
ice cream and you can pop it in the
freezer until it kind of gets a little
bit harder and that is the beautiful
creamy luscious result this one was the
freezin store method for my mocha
chocolate ice cream and then of course
one of my favorites the two ingredient
method for my peanut butter cup ice
cream Oh can't you just taste the bite
and don't forget to download my free ice
cream labels at the link below alright
guys so how easy were those three
methods for making ice cream without a
machine I really hope you enjoy them as
much as we do and use them all summer
long maybe even into winter because
let's face it I just face is good all
year round and I just adore these
totally cute ice cream pint containers
that you can get off Amazon I'd link to
them below and they make for such a fun
project so many flavor customization
options is pretty much limitless so
really get creative here and I'd love to
hear your favorite ice cream flavors
that you plan on making with these
recipes so leave me a comment below I
really hope you guys enjoyed this video
if you did give it a thumbs up and don't
forget to subscribe to my channel I'll
see you next time with another food
video and right now I'm going to
take a bite of my peanut butter cup ice
cream because it looks and smells
amazing
mmm so rich and creamy this is was the
sweetened condensed milk and cream
method and it just is it'll blow your
mind if you haven't made this before so
I'll catch your own soon

content: hello and welcome to cooking table [Applause] [Music] today's recipe will look at a very delicious summer drink chocolate milkshake and here are the list of ingredients that are required for this into a blender jar I am adding in about 1 cup of milk isn't boiled milk the quantity of make depends upon how many other cups of milk shakey requires if you want you can also add a nice ice-cold milk but it is boiled milk and do this I am adding in about 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder cocoa powder also depends upon your choice because some people like it a little dark some people like it a little light and some people like it a little on the a bitter side also and to this I am adding in just about a tablespoon of condensed milk instead of condensed milk you can also add in sugar but I like to I am making this under keep a rich so I am adding in condensed milk here you can totally skip condensed milk and add in the required amount of sugar and to this I am adding in one scoop of vanilla ice cream both vanilla ice cream and the condensed milk have sweetness in them so I am NOT adding in any sugar today so we'll blend all these ingredients together and we come back now I've blended all the ingredients together our chocolate milkshake is ready you can check for sweetness at this point in time and adjusted according to the sweetness that you like now we will transfer this milkshake into the serving glass now before that I like to garnish this serving glass with a little bit of chocolate syrup all this is totally up to your choice and our taste I'm just running the chocolate syrup around the glass and adding in a little bit at the bottom of the glass and transferring the entire chocolate milkshake into this on glass here and to top it off I'm adding in another scoop of vanilla ice cream you can also add in chocolate ice cream or here and finally I'm just shaving in some our chocolate here this is cadburys you can also add in chocolate chips here just a little bit for the garnishing you can also top it off with some nuts of your choice a tasty and delicious super cool summer drink chocolate milk shake is ready subscribe to our YouTube channel and post in your comments and suggestions hit the like button if you enjoy this video and share it with your friends if you are new to our channel welcome and happy cooking also subscribe to our very new tumblr channel from miles away till we see you again with another new and interesting recipe thank you and happy cooking
